channel.title: Comments on: a monstrous unimodular lattice

item.title: By: Theo Johnson-Freyd
item.dc:creator: Theo Johnson-Freyd
item.description:
If I have a lattice defined away from some primes, to what extent can you talk about minimal-norm vectors? Maybe "norm" has to be in some p-adic sense? What I really should mean is to write down the full "spectrum" of the lattice. Then maybe the p-local spectrums glue to the integral spectrum?
Clearly this obliquely-described 196884-dimensional unimodular lattice should be called the "Carnahan lattice".
item.content:encoded:
If I have a lattice defined away from some primes, to what extent can you talk about minimal-norm vectors? Maybe “norm” has to be in some p-adic sense? What I really should mean is to write down the full “spectrum” of the lattice. Then maybe the p-local spectrums glue to the integral spectrum?

Clearly this obliquely-described 196884-dimensional unimodular lattice should be called the “Carnahan lattice”.
